column7: Waste places, roadsides and cultivated fields[17, 43]. Found chiefly in sandy soils in Texas[274].
column8: Europe. Asia. N. America. Naturalized in Britain[17].
column15: Coronopus didymus (L.) Sm. is now a synonym of Lepidium didymum L.
column16: Coronopus didymus is a ANNUAL/BIENNIAL growing to 0.3 m (1ft) by 0.2 m (0ft 8in).  It is in flower from July to September, and the seeds ripen from August to October. The species is hermaphrodite (has both male and female organs). The plant is self-fertile.  Suitable for: light (sandy), medium (loamy) and heavy (clay) soils. Suitable pH: mildly acid, neutral and basic (mildly alkaline) soils. It can grow in  semi-shade (light woodland) or no shade. It prefers  moist soil.
column21: Leaves - raw or cooked[105, 177]. A strong hot cress-like flavour[144, K].
